I think you are using the wrong tool.  You're not making unit, 
integration or regression tests anymore but you're testing the behaviour 
of your system.  If you don't change the predictability of your system 
(i.e. the random generator) it's almost impossible to use JUnit because 
JUnit is testing _exacts_ behaviours, not random one.

All this to say that I only see few solutions
1. the random generator always returns the same number.  You could 
analize how many times a component has been created, using 1, 2, 3 as 
the returned number
2. you write results in a file and analize it statically

Hope it helps you someway

-Vlad
